title: How is technology used in making pencils? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are going to make 100000000 of something, you can afford to spend money on special machines to make each pencil cost less. That is ‘technology’ - many special purpose machines that cannot be used for anything else. The alternative is a hand made pencil that costs $32 each

At the Pencil Factory a “Groover machine” cuts grooves into the slats to simply accept the writing core (or “lead”). Writing cores – made up of a mix of graphite and clay – are placed into the grooves. Coloring pencils may use wax-based cores while many other formulations are utilized in cosmetic pencils.
